website_summaries.verdict: This chunky tower unit is a reliable mainstay for homes in areas that are prone to power brownouts and blackouts.
pros: A squarish mini-tower unit that offers 10 total outlets (5 on battery backup)
When running a generator, the unit handles the power feed without an issue, conditioning power output to multiple electronics
cons: Plastic parts on casing can break easily, so be careful when moving the unit

customer_reviews.title: Avoid!!! Item was defective. No service ...
customer_reviews.text: Avoid !!! Item was defective. No service on return or refund offered. It was clearly defective when built. There was a crack in the side and a wire sticking out from the side and had a strong burnt electrical smell. I was afraid of the thing in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Keene

customer_reviews.title: HUMMING NOISE AFTER 9 MONTHS OF USE
customer_reviews.text: I have always used APC & Belkin battery backups/surge protectors and for the most part they have always given me years of good service without any issues. Well for some reason I decided I would try this Tripp Light 1300VA battery backup for my big screen TV... I had only used for around 9 months and yesterday I noticed it had started making this humming noise, It wasn't very loud at first but now it is much louder and actually overtakes the sound from my TV. I have reached out to the Customer Service department at Tripp Lite to see what they are willing to do about this problem. I will post their reply once I hear back from them.
customer_reviews.author: CoyoteMike

customer_reviews.title: Buzzes after a couple of years
customer_reviews.text: I have had this UPS for 3 years, its worked great. Originally purchased it for a house with bad wiring so that when the AC kicked on there was a sag in my room which would shut my computer down. My current dwelling does not have this problem so its just been for peace of mind mostly. However after 3 years this thing is making a relatively loud buzzing. I considered the fact that the batteries could be dead or on their way out so essentially it is always charging them but after getting replacements it still buzzes. I am replacing it with a power strip because I honestly can't stand to hear that constant buzz.
customer_reviews.author: Josh H.

customer_reviews.title: On My Second One
customer_reviews.text: The unit is guaranteed for 3 years. We had another of our brown-outs here in Florida, one of the hundreds over the years. Today - the battery decided it had had enough. I was horrified - I thought i'd purchased it just a year or so ago. Turns out, the unit was purchased April 2014, and I haven't had to think about it since then I can count on 1 hand, with fingers to spare, the number of electronic devices that have been headache free - and for so many years. Just ordered the same one as a replacement. Why mess with a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Schecter

customer_reviews.title: Puts off a very strong acrid odor; same for the replacement
customer_reviews.text: The first one we received put off a very strong, headache-inducing acrid odor. Assuming it was a lemon, Amazon shipped a replacement, but it's no better. Hoping the smell would dissipate over time, we moved the replacement out to the shop floor, but even there, with full air conditioning 24/7, the acrid odor is still very noticeable after several weeks. It's apparently not going to go away. Impossible to be in any standard office environment with this UPS. We bought this Tripplite 1500VA for the office, and in that contained space, this UPS is totally unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Might as well just use a power strip.
customer_reviews.text: One of the worst purchases I've made in a long time. I've had several UPS over the years - generally to keep things running when the power flickers. They've always been things I didn't have to think about - they just plain work. Since I've had this I've had more system failures than in all the years before. When the power flickers, my systems restart. As far as I can tell, the UPS loses track of the battery state, thinks it's at 0%, and restarts. I cannot get rid of this thing fast enough.
customer_reviews.author: Philo Janus

customer_reviews.title: Never got past the smell. Unit was on for ...
customer_reviews.text: Never got past the smell. Unit was on for several days, with a house fan on it, and the heated plastic smell never dissipated. At that point the additional concern arose of some potential overheating hazard. Never should have waited even the few extra days before shutting it down.
customer_reviews.author: adollarfifty

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: This UPS is a piece of junk. not able to support 30% of load, see video and pics. Save your money. Also Amazon return policy is not clear and now i have a defective new UPS that im not able to return.
customer_reviews.author: JOSE F. DEL VALLE P.

customer_reviews.title: Tripp Lite restored my faith.
customer_reviews.text: I had the 1300 that failed due to a resent earthquake and power spike, and the failure also took out my desktop workstation. After a few calls with tech support, and more recently with claims, Tripp Lite stood up to their product and have more than satisfactorily remedied my issues. Happy to be back in the Tripp Lite fold, and again a on good footing with their product offering.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Browning

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS, AVOID FOR SAFETY
customer_reviews.text: This product is DANGEROUS, first off the plastic holding the battery in place came broken, as well as the item. Got a fault on the first turn on, test and fuse didn't fix so I opened it up to find the horrible build quality and zero quality control. Battery read 26V so that was fine, but the wiring was extremely sloppy soldering with no electrical tape on the sloppy soldered outlets. First off, soldering outlets it just a bad idea...if they pull a lot of power and overheat the solder is at risk of melting. Based on the lack of refund policy the manufacturer KNOWS THEIR PRODUCT IS DANGEROUS.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these units. One connected to my cable modem, router, etc. in the basement, the other connected to my work computer, monitors, ethernet switch, VPN router. Last week, the temps were in the upper 90s for a few days in a row. The added strain on the electric utility was obvious on the volt meter on the front of the unit....showing 105 volts, much lower than the required 115-120 volts. The unit clicked on and showed "boosted"....bringing the output back up to the required 120 VAC.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Has issues
customer_reviews.text: The unit looks nice, but with over a week of troubleshooting with Tripp Lites tech department could never get software to work right. Even with a power failure and the computer shut down the UPS was to shut down after the computer which never happened. Sent the units back and got a CyberPower, there unit is very accurate and works to perfection. Sorry,but would not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: L. Wise

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived broken where batteries never charged. After going through tech support reset (which involved opening the unit) it was ok'd for return warranty repair. They did fix the problem but this UPS supposed 900W was purchased to replace my old 900W unit which the batteries lasted 3X longer than this one. With less than 10% load it barely gives me 1 hr of battery life. The unit's USB connection to pc does not work with Unraid OS where it always loses the connection via usb, so i cannot auto shutdown my pc. This unit is a waste of money or extremely overpriced. I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: LarryK

customer_reviews.title: SHUT DOWN SOFTWARE IS GARBAGE!!
customer_reviews.text: Tripp-Lite makes great UPS's, but their Power Alert software is garbage. Unfortunately, I discovered this only after buying a few of these units. The Power Alert software (services) stops running, won't start at all, or won't see the battery despite the battery showing in Device Manager. I asked my IT contact about this, and he said it's common knowlegde amongst himself and his peers that this software is junk, and always has been. Wonderful. Wish I knew that before. Tech support at Tripp-Lite is useless as well. No solutions for these software failures, tries the usual "must be something in Windows" crap. DO NOT BUY TRIPP-LITE UPS's IF YOU WANT YOUR PC TO SHUT DOWN AUTOMATICALLY!!
customer_reviews.author: DFW

customer_reviews.title: No longer trust Tripp Lite products
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased in August 2019 and unit started to malfunction [no longer communicated with iMac] in January 2020. After spending 4 months going back and forth with support [they blamed Apple for their device not working with computer] , they finally sent another unit to me. This one only lasted about 5 months and stopped working altogether. the battery/surge outlets no longer provide power to any device, fan has stopped working and even though it is now unplugged - the display is still on [although 'frozen' as far as data displayed]. Tripp Lite refuses to refund me for this device [as they did the first time].
customer_reviews.author: MMarino

customer_reviews.title: Decent UPS--Stupid software
customer_reviews.text: The UPS seems to work fine--proper behavior on Test, and on a short power outage since installation. However, the monitoring app has to receive some kind of award for the flakiest program ever to be presented by a purportedly professional organization. It will connect via USB about one out of three times, and after failing will require re-installation--and then not always work either. Give up the idea of being able to set notification or shut-down parameters with anything resembling confidence. Their support web site is a classic in the "You must be too stupid to use this" genre. The slovenly software destroys confidence in both the company and their product.
customer_reviews.author: DanD

customer_reviews.title: Batteries Dead In A Year
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful item. Looks very fancy with all its displays. The first time I had a power failure, which was a year after purchasing it, it would not function. The internal batteries were dead. So, having this plugged in and operating for a year allowed the batteries to die. I have had other different brand units where the batteries lasted a lot longer.
customer_reviews.author: J Doherty

customer_reviews.title: No Installable Power Mgt. Software
customer_reviews.text: For price Tripp lite does not give a cdrom with power management software. They make you download it from their site but it doesn't install and tech support says it's your problem. The software from APC and V CyberPower installs. Without mgt. software the computer will not shut down and just runs on battery for a half an hour. Get some other UPS. Computer Ph.D.
customer_reviews.author: SPeters

customer_reviews.title: I really like Tripplite.
customer_reviews.text: Had problems with a CyberPower UPS, and a Tripplite UPS in close succession. After dealing with 'warranty' on both, the Tripplite is the unit I'll buy going foreword. Learned that 20 years ago too, just needed to re-learn it! Cyber Power unit took a lightning hit, and the USB cable let lighting fry my $200 nas main board. Tripplite didn't even flicker on another machine, and nothing was hurt. We did loose a pair of batteries in two tripplite units, and they tech support took care of us 100%. Completely different story with the other brand!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smells like burning plastic after plugging in- SAME PROBLEM WITH REPLACEMENT UNIT.
customer_reviews.text: Holy stinko batman, I must have gotten a defective unit because after plugging it in it started smelling like burning plastic and not a little, I couldn't even be in the same room because of the acrid smell. And guess what, Amazon doesn't accept returns on these. Update. Talked to them, no too bad, fan not working, will replace unit. I will update my review when I get the replacement. Update. Got a replacement- they came through and sent another one immediately, got it the next day. update 11-1-16 They wanted them all back to see what the problem is now I have none. No replacements- no original units, no refund NOTHING. SAME PROBLEM WITH THE REPLACEMENT.
customer_reviews.author: P. Chesterson

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: worked great for 2 years, then stopped switching to battery power when power fails, have tested batteries, it will recharge the batteries but when AC fails it will not switch over to battery, I've removed the batteries and put them in a solar Electric gate system the batteries are still working great. I have much older Tripp Lite UPS systems that still work.
customer_reviews.author: Shadow

customer_reviews.title: Really good and reliable
customer_reviews.text: This electric backup/surge protector works as it should. I have several items, my desk-top computer, two monitors, 3 external hard drives on the backup ports, and two more external hard drives on the surge side. Electric goes off here pretty often and so far (owned it for about 3 months) it has worked perfectly keeping me online when there is an outage. It has an LCD display that shows the battery charge level, how much load is on the unit and how much electrical output there is. My load right now on with both monitors and computer running is only about 1/3 of it's capacity. I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Excellent BackUp
customer_reviews.text: Brand has been around for many years. It has great protection qualities and the power backup battery will hold for almost an hour after the power goes out. I connect ONLY the Computer and Monitor to the battery side and complete the work I am doing safely. Since the Printer and other devices are less important, I plug them into the protection side without the battery. LCD Display offers data on power rating and lets me know the status in Realtime. It is large and has weight and comes with a cooling fan built-in. Over all, its a very good backup for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Meggie

customer_reviews.title: Solid product but it has a short useful life.
customer_reviews.text: IT certainly works as published. However, I have used this only as a backup 3 years and 3 months ago and had only used its backup functionality a few times (less than 5). However, after only 3 years and 3 months of use it is now totally dead. A battery backup with infrequent use should certainly last longer than this did.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Wilson Family

customer_reviews.title: I would have given 5 starts BUT!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good priced UPS. No problems despite the fact the Box was original and soaking wet. It was hard to hold the box together long enough to carry it indoors. It was not raining out side when delivered, so it got wet somewhere in shipping or on the delivery truck.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Outlived Warranty, Barely...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in 2015 and would you believe it out-lived the 3 year warranty! By half a year. Then the battery back-up power stopped backing up, even though the unit indicates a full charge. Now this doorstop randomly drops power and the computer shuts off instantly. Tripp-Lite needs to stick to outlet strips. Bought another one before this one died. The 2nd one just went belly up after almost 2 years. But they make awesome doorstops. If you need battery backup that will outlive its paperwork, choose a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Steam-Writer

customer_reviews.title: Aren't these supposed to kick in during a power failure?
customer_reviews.text: When will I learn? I junked the Tripp Lite unit before this—not even buying a new battery would make it work—and now this one just failed during a 500 millisecond power cut. Thank God I wasn't working on anything critical during the brief power loss. This will be the last Tripp Lite I ever buy. The only reason I don't give it one star is it didn't start a fire. Yet.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous...not purchase
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this device. Just had one shipped to me with internal components loose. If I was not careful the battery terminals would have touched and caused a fire or worse. Airlines do not allow this product to be shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Bob D

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year while there was construction going on in my house, and i knew the power would be off for 5 hours. I still needed to work, so i got this to keep my wifi going for my laptop. Worked perfectly. 6 months later, we had a short power outage and it wasnthe hottest day of the year. I was able to plug a fan in for 1.5 hours and keep it somewhat bearable. Definitely give this 2 thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: mayhap

customer_reviews.title: Working Great So Far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Had some serious lightning and thunder the other night and it caused some power issues and possible surges. Heard this thing kick in a couple times that night. The next day all was well with everything plugged in to it. One of my other cheap surge protectors was burnt slightly and fried the device attached to it. Good thing I had my sensitive electronics hooked up to the Tripp’s Lite.
customer_reviews.author: Rob of Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Good UPS but software is terrible
customer_reviews.text: If you don't care about using the software for automatic shutdown then you will be very happy with this unit. Deducted a star because the software is so buggy. I write software for a living and would be ashamed to have released something this buggy. Tripp Lite makes a very good UPS and I've been using their products for years and I expect this one will last a long time. It's built well and uses 2 batteries for longer run time and life.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Brent

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: I got this battery backup specifically for it's size. It arrived inside an Amazon box like most shipments are. the outside box looked fine but the manufacturers was damaged. when I opened the box I noticed the unit had a big crack in the plastic. I didn't bother to take it out of it's box, it was damaged and needed to go back. It was a Prime purchase so no problem, but to my surprise it's "not eligible for return". Now I'm stuck with a broken battery backup and no recourse.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph B.

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE 10/10
customer_reviews.text: never needed it for almost two years and then BOOM. power loss followed by some unexpected quest. had this back up unit plugged into router, wifi, VoIP and CCTV. ran for almost two full hours before i got power online never missed a beat. recently added entire network via a power strip and alot of moving wiring around. ran a test and said 148 minute run time. more than needed to get generator to kick in. plans on purchasing additional units for saltwater tank, computers, and other areas. GREAT PRODUCT!!! UPDATE: a year later many power failures over the winter and this unit keep us running
customer_reviews.author: TrueToHeartCowboy

customer_reviews.title: The load rating was not accurate for my equipment
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit to serve as a battery backup for our large format printer. According to the advertised rating, this unit should have been able to handle the load, but it could not. Alarm went off and the screen indicated overload condition. Tech support not helpful. They simply advised that the unit was not designed to be a battery back up for a large format printer. Amazon was great regarding the return.
customer_reviews.author: KenK

customer_reviews.title: Does not auto restart...do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: If you lose power the unit will not restart turns unit offline...if you reach the 900W it will turn the unit off...I purchased 20 of these units for IDF closets...you get what you pay for...spend the extra money and get a unit that works.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Biesinger

customer_reviews.title: lasts 2 years whether used or not
customer_reviews.text: I bought triplite because they have a reputation of high quality. These have been used 4 times in 2 years with generator hooked up before battery is dead. Now within 4 days of one another, both of them failed. Battery shows full charge but when voltage drops below 120 volts, one of them shuts down. the other one never takes over load, it just turns on and off as voltage goes above and below 120. I live in a rural area and the voltage fluctuates from 112 to 124. Bottom line is I'm going back to cyber power. I have one of those that's 3 years old and still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dick Howard

customer_reviews.title: So far this has been a great ups. The price for what you get was ...
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been a great ups. The price for what you get was outstanding. My gaming pc has a 1000 watt power supply so I needed to get a UPS of this caliber. It was easy to set up and I like the informational lcd screen as I can now see how much load my pc is pulling. During normal windows activity im at 122 watts but during gaming Im at about 600 watts. What prompted me to buy this is that my apartment complex seems to have frequent outages especially during the summer and I dont want to risk my over 2000$ pc being damaged. Seems like money well spent to me for the peace of mind
customer_reviews.author: techyoda

customer_reviews.title: USB functionality is broken
customer_reviews.text: A very important part of a UPS is the USB support. This allows connected devices to gracefully shut themselves down when the battery is low. This UPS's USB bus goes down constantly and needs the cable to be physically unplugged and plugged back in to get it working again. I believe this is a well known problem. Very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Super Duty UPS
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the build and quality of this unit. Only had 2 weeks but have not noticed any issues. On the point of some reviewers saying there was a smell, I noticed for 2 days. not an issue for smoeone with sinus issues. I like being able to se the voltage flowing thru UPS. Considering it was less than 1/2 price amd more quality than I normally could afford a great buy. I am replacing a 6 yr. old Tripp-Lite that needed a new battery.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: A good unit but...
customer_reviews.text: I was a little put out when I finally had an extended power outage, and the display saying I had about 40 min left. I was going to keep working for about 10 min while keeping a close eye on it. Then all the sudden the beeps got faster and before I could should everything down, the unit shut off which was about 30 seconds. So if you own one of these, once the you have a power outage, shut your equipment down gracefully asap.
customer_reviews.author: Kendalls63

customer_reviews.title: Got used unit....pitiful
customer_reviews.text: The styrofoam used to pack this ups was not original factory. There were two broken off pieces of styrofoam thrown in the bottom of the box, obviously scraps. The usb cord was missing. Instead they gave me an extra power cord (??). The box had a large hole punched on top (the ups box, not the outer box). The battery meter did not go to full bars after 48 hours charging. Obviously Tripplite does not care about their products and will gladly send you a defective, returned product. BE CAREFUL...THERE ARE NO RETURNS ON THIS ITEM!!!! Not happy at all about the $171 I spent!!!
customer_reviews.author: ernando

customer_reviews.title: REALLY Bad Odor, But Excellent OEM Support
customer_reviews.text: Just like the others that have posted here, from the second I plugged this unit in, a really obnoxious odor began to emanate from it. Within a few hours, it had permeated our entire home. I contacted TL & they're sending a replacement at no charge. They stated it was a known issue on one production run (they verified the serial number of my unit) that went into distribution inventory. They also stated that replacement shipped from factory inventory should not have the same issue. So, if you experience this problem, contact the factory for a direct replacement. Good support, I would not hesitate to buy another product from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: A very impressive UPS from Tripp-Lite
customer_reviews.text: A very impressive UPS from Tripp-Lite. Lots of built in displays allowing you to know exactly what is going on with your incoming power, outgoing power and performance of the UPS with out even connecting the unit to a Computer. An impressive 900w output, 5 battery outlets, 5 Surge only outlets, CATV and Phone line protection options Batteries are HOT-Swappable! This unit holds 2 x 9AH 12v SLA batteries. I would prefer this unit to utilize 18AH Batteries, however I still am satisfied with my purchase of this product!
customer_reviews.author: Sono-sanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Stop now, what's that smell.....
customer_reviews.text: First off, the UPS is working fine and I have no complaints about it's functionality....except..... as noted by a few others, I was taken back by the odor it puts out. Right after I turned it on and had it under normal load (about 20%) I smelt a strong odor from the unit. It smells like some type of electrical, burning rubber kind of smell. I sure hope it goes away.......
customer_reviews.author: Behrcowboy

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected for less than an ACP branded UPS
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say about this, it does what it's supposed to do. I've owned the model previous to this one for many years, and even replaced the battery on it once as preventative maintenance. In my opinion Tripp Lite's UPS's are just as quality as ACP, but less expensive. It makes no noise and is slightly warm to the touch under normal use. When the battery kicks in, a fan turns on and you can very much hear it, but that doesn't matter to me since if I need to use battery power fan noise is the least of my worries.
customer_reviews.author: M Andrea

customer_reviews.title: I need help or support. My home is a ...
customer_reviews.text: I need help or support. My home is a progression of restoration from Harvey. Just now was able to insert this into my system as my office has flooring. Plugs only work on Surge Protection side and do not work on Battery / UPS side. Hoping to get support somewhere. O.K. Completely re installed at different power source and came up working on Batt., and Surge sides. Re-installed back at other loc. and still working 100%. Power can play tricks sometimes. I will say getting anyone by phone these days is next to impossible an that includes Tripp Lite
customer_reviews.author: Craig A Chaloupka

customer_reviews.title: Easily bursts into flames; doesn’t ship well
customer_reviews.text: It arrived in a broken box. Another reviewer posted identical damage. It does indeed give off a smell. Despite the broken case, I plugged it in and it seemed to work. I let it charge overnight and unplugged it in the morning. It shut down. I plugged it back in and pressed the test button. It literally burst into flames and smoke started to pour out of it. Amazon is sending a replacement but I am not confident it will arrive in tact.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This works great, it's exactly what it says it is and maybe more
customer_reviews.text: This works great, it's exactly what it says it is and maybe more. I have this UPS setup to power my personal desktop, personal laptop, company laptop, FiOS Gateway, NAS Box, lamp, cell phone charger and laser printer in the event of a power outage. The two times that I have had to use it for it's intended purpose I got more than enough time for the power to be restored. The longest it was on battery was 2 hours, with my iMac, personal laptop, company laptop, cell phone charger and FiOS Gateway drawing from it and it still showed I had close to 90 minutes of power remaining.
customer_reviews.author: Marc “The Mac Guy”

customer_reviews.title: This is easy to install with a nice display
customer_reviews.text: I have done practically zero to this thing. No configuration, nothing. So this is just an initial review. I will play with it a bit to learn about the display but the first impression is that it is a nice unit. Hope the batteries are easy to install. The battery looks 100%, the load is on the first indicator, with an iMac 27" on it. I will put a few internal/external hard disk on this unit. Has a mute button, which will come in handy. Here in mid-Colorado the power goes out about once a month.
customer_reviews.author: JoninOC

customer_reviews.title: Display
customer_reviews.text: When shopping around for UPS sytems for my home pc I didnt take into consideration some of the features that these things had. The digital display shows the voltage coming from the outlet you're plugged into letting you monitor when the voltage rises and drops which is neat. On the other hand the display is very bright so at night when you're trying to sleep the blue light illuminates your room which is annoying. I fixed this by putting a piece of paper over it. Besides this it seems to be a good UPS and does the job as intended
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: A very reliable product but draws additional current
customer_reviews.text: I just bought my 3rd one of these to replace another defective APC unit. These units have more capacity and so far fewer issues than the APC ones they replaced. Two issues I have with them is they draw more current after fully charged and the LCD screen is very bright and cannot be dimmed via the front panel. Would love to see these issues addressed but will live with them to improve reliability.
customer_reviews.author: JD13

customer_reviews.title: My second buy on this.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one years ago and it is still doing it's job. The first has moved to the monitors and this new one is on the Computer so happy to have bought two with one still orking years after If you do work on your computer then a UPS is not an idea is it absolutely necessary. Thes also handle voltage drops. Indeed I have seen the power be below what I needed for the equipment so two thumbs up for the "safety" aspect of these UPSs'
customer_reviews.author: Ernst

customer_reviews.title: Shipping Problems
customer_reviews.text: The weight of this unit is very heavy. When received this unit it had been severely damaged for the shipping process. The plastic frame was in pieces. After testing the unit with minor repairs the unit tested great, so I decided to keep it fearing another unit would have more damage. This is a heavy duty Power Supply this is designed with all my specifications need. I needed the security of this unit as soon as possible, the South has a lot of server weather.
customer_reviews.author: M Rawls

customer_reviews.title: Great UPS. I've had it for only a month ...
customer_reviews.text: Great UPS. I've had it for only a month and it's already paid for itself several times with the spotty electric brown outs in my town. The power has blinked on and off long enough that it used to recycle the power on my PC, but with the Tripp Lite it doesn't even blink. I love the 6 different screens you can cycle on the LCD display - power consumption, current used, etc Also, when connected via the provided USB Windows 10 easily recognized it as a battery device with no need for any drivers to be installed.
customer_reviews.author: Bloop

customer_reviews.title: Great item to protect your electronics!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, it has already saved me twice when the power went out... I have my Gaming PC, two monitors, modem, and a lamp hooked up to the battery side and it holds firm to allow me to shut down when we loose power. It is pretty cool to see everything else shut down while you just continue along like nothing happened! Some people complain about the screen being too bright at night, but i have it placed down on the floor on a stand near my bed and it does not bother me. I could see if you had it eye level that you could have issues, but just stick a post-it on it or something.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Nice item for minor fluctuations
customer_reviews.text: We were having trouble where lights would flicker and it was just enough to power down computers. Then the computer couldn't find hard drives. This eliminated that need. One side has batter backup, the other surge protection. Since we have started using it, a dozen or so flickers and not once did the computer notice. Have only had 10 min or less of power failure so no idea on actual battery life. It is meeting our needs for the fluctuations.
customer_reviews.author: BooBooKitty

customer_reviews.title: The first arrived DOA.
customer_reviews.text: So why 5 stars? Tech support. They were great. I got a new unit and I ended up with an extra set of batteries, but now I have a perfectly good UPS. Powers a refrigerator and Freezer with no issue. Cleans the ACDC lines and I have had no circuit pops. Because I have multiple warning sensors, I will not lose Meat like I have in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality battery backup
customer_reviews.text: Just plug and play. Works great. Noise suppression keeps the voltage clean and constant. Tripp Lite builds a high quality product. The self-test feature is a great idea too. Periodically check your device to make sure it is working properly. You can't go wrong with this protection for your computer, audio, and video equipment. This is my second Tripp Lite battery backup device for my equipment and I will gladly purchase another when this one is used up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid and dependable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this mainly because of the line stabilization that helps keep your power flow smooth when you have under or over voltage situations. Easy to use and instantly kicks in as expected, electronics show no signs of realizing any issues with the power. Size is manageable and it does its job without needing supervision.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: 2ND BATTERY BACK UP FAILED
customer_reviews.text: This is VERY LOUD. The Powerchute Software Must be Downloaded Online, and The Software Does NOT Allow The Computer to Remain ON When Idle. I Use Many Tripp Lite Products and LOVE Tripp Lite Gear, But This Battery Backup Has Loud Fan and Makes It Difficult For Use In Recording Studios I Will Say Again, TRIPP LITE Makes Awesome Gear, and Own Many Many Products From Tripp Lite Myself, But This Batt Backup Fails UPDATE: 4/23/16--Tripp Lite Replaced This September 2015 And It Is Malfunctioning Again! -- I Will Never Buy A Tripp Lite Battery Back up Again. This Is Absolutely Disappointing!!
customer_reviews.author: Ronaldo Martino

customer_reviews.title: Does the job on a respectable budget
customer_reviews.text: I run my workstation on one of these and it has saved me a couple times. My house is a bit old and the service is only 100 amps - not exactly what you want to run a server room and office! Still, we work with the cards life deals us and while I do have intentions to change my service, this little guy, in conjunction with a few of his friends, have saved me multiple times. The price is right and they work. It isn't fancy but it does the job and has (knock on wood) never failed me, and that's what counts.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Good instructions. LED display has many features such as input and output voltage, battery voltage, load percent and wattage. I have two large Dell workstations attached (T3500 and T7500) and the output load shows 18%. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will not supply power for our server.
customer_reviews.text: Does not keep our server running when we have an outage or brown out. Tech with Tripp Lite says it is an incompatability with our server and the AC waveform. We had cheap and small UPCs before that would keep it going and those were definately not Pure Sine Wave. Either bad product or bad tech advice? Either way not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A

customer_reviews.title: Complete Fail in 3 Months
customer_reviews.text: First off Tripp Lite is from that country which shall not be mentioned. Which explains why the batteries fail after 3 months. Duracell actually makes a 9AH battery for this unit but you'll have to search for it; only way I know to keep this UPS running.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Halley

customer_reviews.title: Set it and forget it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great backup. Have had to use it twice since installing and, honestly forgot it was there during the two short power outages. I run this parallell with another UPS; one stricly runs powers the PC and a monitor, the other powers the dual monitor, and work lamp and peripherals. Combined I'm good for 3+ hours during an outage.
customer_reviews.author: R. J.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. So far better than APC
customer_reviews.text: I am keeping a network rack alive with these. Seem to work fine and batteries have held up great.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: a backup battery plain and simple
customer_reviews.text: plug it into the wall and plug your computer and monitor into it. Plain and simple and works fine. I'll have to wait for a power failure to know if it's really good so I might repost after the next storm. There is never a good hurricane around when you need one to test a product... Probably a good thing ;)
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Nelkin

customer_reviews.title: Quits with no warning, no backup
customer_reviews.text: I bought this UPS about five years ago, which puts it outside the warranty. It worked just fine, and with minimal load, when it suddenly quit without any warning: no alarms, and no backup power. And this was in the midst of a backup operation. So beware that this model may quit without warning and take down all your equipment plugged into it.
customer_reviews.author: Stardragon

customer_reviews.title: Good UPS, plug-and-play with my Synology NAS unit
customer_reviews.text: I plugged the USB cable into my Synology NAS and it picked up the UPS right away. Battery life is good and the auto-shutdown of the NAS gracefully shuts things down if the power is off too long. Really like the TrippLite brand, they seem to still be making decent products these days.
customer_reviews.author: C.R.

customer_reviews.title: dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: the unit was just turned on and no screen I opened it up to make sure the batteries were connected and a big piece of the housing was broke above the battery area
customer_reviews.author: mudman

customer_reviews.title: Can't complain
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 3 years. Everything on it, defies the power outages. Pretty strong. It works
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Williams

customer_reviews.title: Tested good during a brown out and kept internet up for ...
customer_reviews.text: I work from home every so often, but during a Record breaking cold snap, the municipal power kept going out and kept me from working for almost 4 hours. Surges would make the cable modem reset and just as it connected, we would have another surge. Ordered this to ensure wi-fi and internet cable modem stayed on during surges and outages. Tested good during a brown out and kept internet up for my laptop so I could continue to work. Love that it has replaceable batteries. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Good surpressor and backup unit
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for a Tripp-Lite Smart1500XL. According to the specs, this unit's output is 900 watts. So far, it has performed as good as my old Tripp-Lite. The digital readout is a cool feature. I am currently running two towers, 5 monitors, speakers, and a digitizing tablet. The current load is at ±300watts. I tested the time it took before completely shutting down, and it was around 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: r glenn barefoot

customer_reviews.title: Tripp Lite unit re-recommended (paying it forward) by me.. So far, so good...
customer_reviews.text: Tripp Lite was highly recommended to us all by Jerry Pournelle, the ex-BYTE columnist in various articles. I took him at his word this time around, and am not disappointed (yet, anyway). Unit is doing just fine at this point with multiple PC's and external drives (though not all up at the same time). Too much plastic in the case for my taste, but not surprising. Otherwise appears sturdy, has nice 'telemetry' (front panel Voltage and other info displayed), and stays a fairly steady 122V output so far. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Product is great but software is crap
customer_reviews.text: Product is great but software is crap. Doesn't work well with LInux Nas units, but works fine for Home Theater and Desktop computer where I really don't worry about powering down cleanly as much. Easy install funny cause this unit comes pre-set no connecting leads or pulling "block pins" to activate batteries like some others units. I really wish there was better support/drivers for us with remote shutdowns or controlling equipment state during power outage. Other then the above this is a solid stable unit.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K.

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service.. First unit not so much. Waiting on replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Unit had issues out of the box. Worked for 5-10 minutes, and then the screen flashed and went blank. Unplugging it did not reset. Plugs on the back did not output any power. I will say that Tripp-lite has probably one of the best customer service lines i've ever dealt with. Friendly gentleman Rafael assisted me with troubleshooting and promptly scheduled replacement. Virtually no hold time, or headache aside from the fact it was defective out of the box. I will update my review once I receive the replacement. Bummed that I cannot immediately replace my failing one, but lemons lemonade.
customer_reviews.author: i spend too much money here

customer_reviews.title: Back up unit with read out on front facia
customer_reviews.text: This is the only unit with a real time readout on the front facia. I bought this unit because my previous UPS units were failing after starting my generator. I did not know the reason until I bought this unit which also failed but revealed the reason via the Hz reading on the front. I found that the generator was running @ 66 Hz during no load conditions which would drop the unit into battery back-up mode rather than on-line. I was then able to calibrate my generator frequency and solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: SMART1500LCDT is a solid product
customer_reviews.text: So far so good two plus weeks or use and one power failure later. The unit performed perfectly. SMART1500LCDT is a solid product,and the only negative is TRIPP LITE put the wrong manual in the box. In a way with a power or UPS product the wrong manual (SMX15000LCDT) could be a bit scary at best, and deadly dangerous at worst. I actually read the manual (it is VERY similar), but things in that manual didn't make sense. Such as setting the input voltage range..........first clue - wide is "170V-280V", whereas on the 1500LCDT, voltage is not setable! So easy enough to download, print and staple the correct manual. All seems well and unit is bone simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bill D.

customer_reviews.title: COVER YOUR ASSETS WITH TRIPP LITE
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Tripp Lite battery back-up I've owned. Previous one identical to this one. Both of these were purchased because an APC unit failed during a power glitch when each Tripp Lite kept on doing its job. Will NEVER own another APC product. Experience with their service dept is a non-starter. If you want the best at a reasonable price, go with Tripp Lite.
customer_reviews.author: William Bass

customer_reviews.title: Came quick, seems to work fine
customer_reviews.text: To be fair I cant speak to support or battery life as I havent had to deal with any issues that require this to come in to play yet. It came fairly quick and was bought to replace an old one that I had for 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Blu Belle

customer_reviews.title: Amazon great the manufacture great product reliability didnt impress me/ actually ...
customer_reviews.text: Company stands behind thier product . i had to send the first one back due to sparking and a small fire in the unit that occurred when i pressed the test button.Amozon sent me a new one , i used it for a few months then i packed it away because i moved and dont have it set up yet. I will be honest I am a little leary of the potential problems ? I should have taken the refund. Amazon great the manufacture great product reliability didnt impress me/ actually something of the nature should never do that as it could be a real problem.
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN

customer_reviews.title: 5 years later still working
customer_reviews.text: Only had to replace the batteries which is to be expected. Working well and recognized by windows 7 as a battery ups via usb connection. One star reduction is for the archaic interface "PowerAlert Agent Console" to talk to the device outside of windows to do more advance set up. It wouldn't connect for me even after calling tech support. Windows power management was all I needed to configure to shut the pc down after x minutes on battery.
customer_reviews.author: Artemas

customer_reviews.title: Dependable.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these...and it's a good feeling having the security of protection (and being able to continue a project for awhile) when one encounters a power-surge or even outage...as we have in Los Angeles. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Clemens

customer_reviews.title: Nice hardware, terrible software
customer_reviews.text: I like the design of the UPS hardware, but the PowerAlert® Device Management Software is some of the worst software that I have ever seen. It crashes. It leaves a CMD window open in order to run Java. I think this software was designed to run many UPSs in an enterprise environment. For home use it is pure awful.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Enyeart

customer_reviews.title: Destroyed my computer
customer_reviews.text: This piece of junk fried a $400 video card and $800 monitor as soon as I turned it on. Not only do I recommend in the strongest terms that you avoid this product, I'm giving serious consideration to retaining the services of an attorney.
customer_reviews.author: ApathyCurve

customer_reviews.title: A great way to protect your devices from at least the short power failures.
customer_reviews.text: I'm one of these crazy people who like to protect not only my computers, but also my devices, so my TV and DVR are two of the devices on this box, the TV on the side that shuts down when the power disappears, but the DVR on the side that continues recording for a few minutes just in case it's a short power failure. I protect my desktop computer and router and a few other devices with my other UPS unit.
customer_reviews.author: JohnAroundTheCornerReviews

customer_reviews.title: Very loud... from a person with bad ears
customer_reviews.text: This thing is LOUD, feels like I have a bug zapper in my office now and it's driving me crazy. I don't ever have trouble with things being too loud but this is almost unbearable. Other than that, works fine enough, doesn't keep my equipment running very long (approx. 15/20mins) when outages occur though...
customer_reviews.author: Tucker Harris

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I live in a rural area and had a power outage that caused my power supply unit to fail, I wish I bought something like this a long time ago. Its as easy as plugging in and turning on and your protected. If you have satellite internet you can keep your internet connection during an outage.
customer_reviews.author: jesse

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: After using APC for many years, I decided to try Tripp Lite. This review may be premature because I haven't had this unit for very long. I really like the status screen and its overall look. I use this to backup a cable box, modem, router, Xbox One, and a phone. The load of these items shows up as one bar on the status screen. (There are 5 bars for load status) I don't really care if the battery fails every couple of years, because they are easy to change and not too expensive. I just want the electronics to last longer than all of my APC units I threw in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 40 days, Support does not know why
customer_reviews.text: Shut down and took everything protected with it. They did help figure out how to get it back working. However they do not know why it went offline and shut down the power to the protected items. The surge protected lines had no issue. At this point they do not know what happened. I requested they log it in my account on this item. I am keeping records also. If it fails again, it WILL be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Donald French

customer_reviews.title: Just had my first save
customer_reviews.text: A couple weeks ago, a thunderstorm with a tornado warning rolled through, and the entire apartment lost power. I wouldn't have even noticed had my UPS not had a long, loud beep telling me that it switched to battery power. I have a not-so-energy-efficient gaming rig; My computer, with everything else attached, uses roughly 700w, give or take. Even with that draw, the battery sustained my computer and cable modem for 5-10 minutes. That's actually kind of incredible if you think about it. It shut my computer down when the battery reached 20% just like it should. It worked completely uninterrupted during multiple power flickers. 5 stars - it did exactly what I wanted it to! :D
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M

customer_reviews.title: Update to our review.
customer_reviews.text: bought this to help keep our iMac up when I shut down the power when checking our offgrid power system Update. Does not communicate with iMac. Just started saying battery low and trying to shut down iMac. It passes slef test but had to remove the USB cable. No customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Bill and Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Great Batter Back Up and even better Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Works great. At first there was a "transformer" smell, but after speaking with customer service, I waited a few days and the smell went away. Tripp LIte offered to replace the unit right away, but in the end that wasn't necessary. Great customer service and it was a live person who knew what he was talking about. I would buy again if another unit becomes needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: When does the smell go away?
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over a month now. There has only been 1 brief power outage. It kicked on, although not instant. My modem/router still recycled. It has a strong electrical smell. I have it in my office and just today when I opened the door I could still smell it. It does say in the instructions that it will have a smell for a few days.....this has been a few weeks. Don't know whether to trust it or not. Seems to work, but the continued smell is worrisome.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to high price competitors.
customer_reviews.text: I do IT for a living and this is my turn to Tripp Lite for a reasonably priced alternative to Eaton and APC, both of which failed recently on too many client PCs. This is for my own server and externals. It is running a Mac mini and a dozen devices, network switch, external RAIDs, etc. The ease of setup was good. Thus far it has passed all my tests. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: n71403

customer_reviews.title: Good Unit, fair price
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Tested it a few times with test button and manual unplugging @350w load. Never used the driver for it and never needed it. The LCD tells you what you need to know. ***It is possible to configure your PC to shutdown without the driver from tripp lite.*** Simply plug this in via USB and you will have a battery status indicator from there om your system tray just like you are using a laptop...go to your power settings and change what you want your PC to do with low/ critical battery power. Keep it simple guys, don't overcompcliate things with 3rd party drivers if ya don't have to!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Initial thought - Is there a reason the screen doesn't turn off?
customer_reviews.text: The screen doesn't turn off. Is there a reason the screen doesn't turn off? Works fine other than this. Will need a few months of thunderstorms to see how well it holds up beyond that - we shall see. NUT (UPS Monitoring software) does not work with this unit off pfSense. This looks to be an issues the the way BSD handles the USB for it. QNAPs can't monitor it either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: easy and working
customer_reviews.text: 2nd time in use first was the snow storm that rolled in kept the TV and Computer going seamless for power going off and coming back on in 1.5 hours without power, and today 60 to 80 mph winds electricity is flickering on and off flawless transition back and forth TV, Computer, printer, 11 security cameras and dvr.. For me it works for what I purchased it for
customer_reviews.author: P. Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: BAD software.
customer_reviews.text: It works, but the software is horrible. I strongly suggest not using it and going into Windows power options-advanced and setting the shutdown parameters there. Windows will treat the UPS like a laptop battery and shut down at a setting you choose. Also this unit smells quite strongly. Not sure what is up with that. The front panel LCD is nice. EDIT - the coax surge suppressor seems to be causing network issues. I am going around it for now. Might return this thing. Also the front LCD wiggles around. I used to think Tripp-Lite was the best stuff out there too................
customer_reviews.author: joe-maryland

customer_reviews.title: triplite smart 1300lcdt
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it is intended to do. Fans are not noisy at all. Seems to be slightly warm, however, due to its size and capacity, this is not uncommon. I feel that this item is far superior to APC's and other competitive brands in terms of capacity and price. I would definitely purchase another should the need arise. I currently run a 60 inch LG plasma and DishNetwork receiver on this unit and noted capacity on the LCD display shows I am using approximately 45% capacity. When the power fails, I use a large diesel generator and this unit equalizes the voltage/amperage adequately to utilize both connected devices.
customer_reviews.author: ProCom
